comment: Any subset of a module is always linearly independent if the underlying ring has at most one element. Since the underlying ring cannot be the empty set (see ~ lmodsn0 ), this means that the underlying ring has only one element, so it is a zero ring. (Contributed by AV, 14-Apr-2019.) (Revised by AV, 27-Apr-2019.)
